subject: p14353044
History: Lower extremity swelling, question of CHF.
Findings: AP and lateral views of the chest. Posterior fixation hardware in the thoracic spine is several years old. Elevation of the right lung base has been increasing slowly over the past years. Small right pleural effusion is comparable to, slightly larger than on. Left subclavian line ends in the distal SVC. Heart size is normal. Cardiomediastinal and hilar contours are normal. Right basilar linear atelectasis is unchanged. No consolidation or pulmonary edema is present.
Impression: No evidence of cardiac decompensation. Chronic unexplained elevation, right lung base and chronic, small to moderate right pleural effusion.
